result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon Marie Bellanger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Shannon Marie Bellanger
parties.address: 872 West Oakland Park Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33311

parties.name: Burnett County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Restitution was pre-paid prior to disposition and will be disbursed to the victim by the Clerk of Courts.

1) All payments are ordered to be paid to the BURNETT COUNTY CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE.  The defendant has sixty (60) days to make payment of any amount ordered unless other arrangements are made with the Clerk of Court's office. Make checks or money orders payable to "BURNETT COUNTY" and send to: Burnett County Clerk of Court, 7410 Cty. Rd. K,  #115, Siren, WI 54872.    
Payments may be made either in person, by mail, or online either through wicourts.gov or through paygov.us. (subject to each website's processing fees).
2) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon Marie Bellanger

defendant.name: Bellanger, Shannon Marie
defendant.address: 872 West Oakland Park Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33311

records.addlTxt: Final Reminder Notice and Judgment for Unpaid Fines returned.  ""Attempted Not Known, Unable to Forward."

09:08 AM Cases 20CF305 and 22CM18 called together.  Defendant, Shannon Marie Bellanger, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak and John Swanberg.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  All parties by video.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Pollak: def entering pleas to Ct 2 of 20CF305 and Ct 1 of 22CM18; joint rec of costs-only; requesting to waive all but DNA surcharge in 22CM18; def has prepaid restitution to the Clerk of Courts.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas.  Def enters pleas of no contest.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2 of 20CF305 and Count 1 of 22CM18 and orders a JOC; remaining counts are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorneys asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
Ct 1 of 22CM18- restitution of $705.92 (to be taken from cash bond posted); $443 court costs
Ct 2 of 20CF305- $443 court costs
Def has 60 days to set up a payment plan for court costs.
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

Initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Shannon Marie Bellanger
Current: 872 West Oakland Park Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33311 United States  (Effective: 02-11-2022)

Initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Court was advised of defendant's location.

02:01 PM Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court makes a special appearance.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def fails to appear.  State requests warrant, $706 cash bond (to cover restitution requested).  Atty Pollak argues to stay the warrant for def to get Atty Pollak appointed and get a new court date.  Court takes judicial notice of case in front of Judge John Anderson.  Court orders warrant, $250 cash.
